item.description:
If you have never been to this treasured gem in Connecticut, make it a point to not only visit the clock museum, but enjoy some Italian music as well. 

 

 

Fri. Feb. 10- Italian Concert with Salvatore Basile

ACWM is honoring the men and women of Italian heritage who contributed so many hours to the clock and watch industry over the years with a special St. Valentine's Day weekend concert on Friday, February 10th at 7pm at the museum.  Basile charms his audiences with heartfelt songs, sung all in Italian.  Each song is discussed in English prior to being sung.   Price per seat is $15 each or $25 per couple.  Seating is limited to 50 patrons total.  Tickets can be purchased at the museum or at the Central Connecticut Chambers of Commerce office on Main Street in Bristol.

 Salvatore Basile was born into Italian music 60 years ago in Girifalco, Italy.  His father was his first musical influence because he heard his father play the Napoletan love songs dedicated to his mother.  Salvatore has made a hobby of studying and playing such songs to audiences all over New England.  He recently retired from 35 years of teaching English literature in the Hartford school system.

 

Call and reserve your space today! 860.583.6070

 

http://clockandwatchmuseum.webs.com/calendarofevents.htm
item.name: Friday, Feb. 10- Italian Concert with Salvatore Basile
